title: St Gerard Majella Novena For Expectant Mothers
description: St Gerard Majella, the Mothers‚Äô Saint, was an Italian Redemptorist lay brother whose intercession led to the miraculous healing of a mother near death from childbirth. Pray this novena for expectant mothers and women struggling with infertility.

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

O great Saint Gerard, beloved servant of Jesus Christ, perfect imitator of your meek and humble Savior, and devoted child of the Mother of God, enkindle within my heart one spark of that heavenly fire of charity which glowed in your heart and made you an angel of love. O glorious Saint Gerard, because when falsely accused of crime, you did bear, like your Divine Master, without murmur or complaint, the calumnies of wicked men, you have been raised up by God as the patron and protector of expectant mothers. Preserve me from danger and from the excessive pains accompanying childbirth, and shield the child which I now carry, that it may see the light of day and receive the purifying and life-giving waters of baptism through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen. (mention request here‚Ä¶)

Answered Prayers From This Novena

I prayed a Novena for Expectant Mothers to St. Gerard Majella early in my third pregnancy in 1988. I was experiencing some complications and was afraid of losing the baby. My healthy baby girl was born on October 16 of that year- the feast day of St. Gerard. She chose Gerard as her Confirmation name.

Now she is in her mid-thirties and has experienced two miscarriages. I‚Äôm once more turning to St. Gerard and praying that she and her husband will be able to have a baby.

from D.M.

My daughter who is expecting twins was told that one of the twins had an enlarged heart with fluid in the vessels. I started this novena 9 days before the follow up with the neonatal cardiologist who performed an echocardiogram. The Echocardiogram clearly showed a healthy heart . Thank you St Gerard.

from J.D.

My 39 year old daughter back in February 2024 told me she was pregnant with her first child. In March I was leaving Shop Rite. I was walking in the parking lot going down a lane that my car was not in. I saw something shining from the sun on the ground. It was to plastic medals. One was of Saint Christopher, the other of Saint Gerard.

When home I looked up Saint Gerard to learn he was the patron saint of expecting mothers. I began saying prayers to Saint Gerard. In July she was told her baby boy had a rare cyst on his duct connecting to his liver. An operation was necessary 2 months after birth. August 25th I started this novena to Saint Gerard. On Saturday August 31, 7th day of the novena, my daughter had another sonogram.

The baby turned in such a way that the tech, who took more time, saw that the cyst was in his stomach not the duct. He has been diagnosed as having Duodenal Artesia Stenosis, which means an operation upon birth. We live in NJ. Upon the urging of a nurse friend, she told her she had to go to Children‚Äôs Hospital of Philadelphia. She talked to her doctor and he agreed. He sent a referral on the 7th day of the novena. On Monday, she was 35 weeks pregnant. The ninth day of the novena.

On Tuesday, the day after the novena she received a call from CHOP to go there today, Wednesday Sep. 4 for extensive testing. They have accepted her to deliver there and have the baby operated on immediately after birth to save his life. Thank you Saint Gerard for placing the medals in my path and for placing people in my daughter‚Äôs path to save her baby. She wanted her baby to have a biblical name. His name will be Lukas James. I named my daughter 40 years ago a name which means in Greek, little Mary, after the Blessed Mother who has answered my prayers, especially as a child. üôè
